URGENT - WINTER WEATHER MESSAGE
NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE GRAND RAPIDS MI
348 AM EST MON JAN 5 2015

MIZ073-051700-
/O.CAN.KGRR.WW.Y.0001.000000T0000Z-150105T1700Z/
/O.CAN.KGRR.WS.A.0001.150106T0200Z-150106T1800Z/
/O.EXA.KGRR.WC.Y.0001.150105T0900Z-150105T1700Z/
CALHOUN-
INCLUDING THE CITY OF...BATTLE CREEK
348 AM EST MON JAN 5 2015

...WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY...
...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS CANCELLED...
...WINTER STORM WATCH IS CANCELLED...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN GRAND RAPIDS HAS ISSUED A WIND
CHILL ADVISORY...WHICH IS IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TODAY. THE
WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY HAS BEEN CANCELLED. THE WINTER STORM
WATCH HAS BEEN CANCELLED. 

HAZARDOUS WEATHER...

 * SNOW SHOWERS HAVE DIMINISHED ACROSS THE COUNTY THIS MORNING. NO
   SIGNIFICANT ACCUMULATIONS ARE EXPECTED TODAY. SOME LIGHT SNOW
   IS EXPECTED TONIGHT AND EARLY TUESDAY.

 * WIND CHILL READINGS OF 10 TO 20 BELOW ZERO WILL BE LIKELY INTO
   THIS MORNING BEFORE IMPROVING SOME THIS AFTERNOON.

IMPACTS...

 * ROADS WILL BE ICY AND SNOW COVERED AS SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE OFF
   AND ON THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING.

 * FROSTBITE COULD OCCUR IN 45 MINUTES OR LESS ON EXPOSED SKIN.

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

 * A WIND CHILL ADVISORY IS ISSUED WHEN A STRONG WIND WILL COMBINE
   WITH COLD TEMPERATURES TO CREATE DANGEROUSLY COLD CONDITIONS
   FOR EXPOSED SKIN. THE WIND WILL MAKE IT FEEL LIKE IT IS 15
   DEGREES BELOW ZERO OR COLDER FOR A PERIOD OF SEVERAL HOURS.
   THOSE PLANNING TO VENTURE OUTDOORS SHOULD USE COMMON SENSE AND
   DRESS WARMLY... MAKING SURE THAT ALL EXPOSED SKIN IS COVERED.

 * WEATHER PREPAREDNESS INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE ON LINE AT 
   WWW.READY.GOV/WINTER AND HTTP://GO.USA.GOV/5OG.

/O.EXT.KGRR.WW.Y.0001.000000T0000Z-150106T1700Z/
OCEANA-NEWAYGO-
INCLUDING THE CITIES OF...HART...FREMONT
348 AM EST MON JAN 5 2015

...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL NOON EST TUESDAY...
...WINTER STORM WATCH IS CANCELLED...

THE NATIONAL WEATHER SERVICE IN GRAND RAPIDS HAS CANCELLED THE
WINTER STORM WATCH. THE WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IS NOW IN EFFECT
UNTIL NOON EST TUESDAY. 

HAZARDOUS WEATHER...

 * SNOW SHOWERS WILL CONTINUE ON AND OFF THROUGH TODAY WITH
   ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS OF AN INCH OR TWO EXPECTED.

 * BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW WILL CONTINUE THIS MORNING BEFORE
   DIMINISHING THIS AFTERNOON AS WINDS DIMINISH.

 * WIND CHILLS OF 10 TO 20 BELOW ZERO WILL CONTINUE EARLY THIS
   MORNING BEFORE IMPROVING THIS AFTERNOON.

 * SNOW SHOWERS WILL PICK UP IN INTENSITY THIS EVENING AND WILL
   CONTINUE THROUGH THE OVERNIGHT HOURS. AN ADDITIONAL 2 TO 4 INCHES
   OF SNOW CAN BE EXPECTED TONIGHT.

IMPACTS...

 * ROADS WILL BE ICY AND SNOW COVERED AS SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE AND
   TEMPERATURES REMAIN IN THE SINGLE DIGITS TODAY.

 * VISIBILITIES WILL BE REDUCED AT TIMES IN FALLING SNOW AND 
   BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW. 

 * FROSTBITE COULD OCCUR IN 45 MINUTES OR LESS ON EXPOSED SKIN. 

PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS...

 * THE MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF TRANSPORTATION REMINDS MOTORISTS 
   TO ADJUST SPEEDS BASED ON THE CONDITIONS... AND TO TAKE IT 
   SLOW IN ICE AND SNOW. 

 * WEATHER PREPAREDNESS INFORMATION IS AVAILABLE ON LINE AT 
   WWW.READY.GOV/WINTER AND HTTP://GO.USA.GOV/5OG.

   ADDITIONAL ACCUMULATIONS OF 1 TO 3 INCHES EXPECTED.

   DIMINISHING THIS AFTERNOON AS WINDS DIMINISH.

   MORNING BEFORE IMPROVING THIS AFTERNOON.

 * SNOW WILL PICK UP IN INTENSITY THIS EVENING AND WILL BECOME
   LOCALLY HEAVY AT TIMES WITH SNOWFALL RATES OF 1 TO 2 INCHES PER
   HOUR POSSIBLE. ACCUMULATIONS TONIGHT AND TUESDAY MORNING WILL
   RANGE FROM 3 TO 6 INCHES WITH LOCALLY HIGHER AMOUNTS POSSIBLE.

IMPACTS...

 * ROADS WILL BE ICY AND SNOW COVERED AS SNOW SHOWERS CONTINUE AND
